metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1088 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
iproute2 before 3.3.0 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a temporary file used by (1) configure or (2) examples/dhcp-client-script.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iproute - 3.12.0-2
No subscription required

iproute2 - 3.12.0-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Issues are in the configure script and an example script, which doesn't seem to be used anywhere.

criterions.comment: iproute2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.0-2').
iproute2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.0-2').
